title: Annoy Putin—Watch This Movie
sub_head: At the screening of a film about Soviet horror, thugs arrive to intimidate free-thinking Russians.
body:
Last year this column lauded the brilliant film “Mr. Jones,” which chronicles the Soviet Union’s mass starvation of Ukraine during the murderous reign of Stalin—and the 1930s media coverup led by Walter Duranty of the New York Times. A year later, the film hasn’t gotten any more popular among Russian enemies of liberty.
A recent Washington Post editorial noted that Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny, a courageous critic of Vladimir Putin’s regime, remains unjustly incarcerated a year after he was the target of an assassination attempt. The Post editorial board adds:
